Dear Andrea Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Title & (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Section supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
Description perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/10/24, a youth grabbed a knife from the kitchen and acted
like they were going to stab another youth. They threatened to kill
the youth with the knife. A staff member intervened.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 12/17/24.
Complainant reported Youth B came into his office on 12/9/24 and
expressed concerns for her safety because Youth A threatened to
stab her with pencils, pens and knives. Complainant reported
Youth B told him Youth A has choked her before, but stated the
fights were mutual between them. Complainant reported he called
and spoke to Chief Administrator (CA) to make her aware of the
concerns, and request she take appropriate action to ensure their
safety. Complainant reported on 12/10/24, Youth B came into his
office and stated Youth A tried to stab her with a knife that
morning at breakfast. Youth B told Complainant he had a butcher
knife, stood in the kitchen window and made a motion towards her
with the knife, but didn’t say anything. Youth B reported she was
terrified and ran off. Complainant reported he spoke to CA in the
afternoon, and CA told him there was a misunderstanding
because Youth A was only messing around. Complainant reported
he spoke to Staff 1 on 12/11/24 to get her side of the story, and he
also watched the video. Complainant reported he was told it was a
steak knife, but then was told it was a butter knife. Complainant
reported he spoke with Youth A, who admitted it was a steak
knife. Complainant reported he was still unclear how Youth A
ended up with access to a knife in the first place.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/16/24. Youth A reported he had found a steak knife left on the
dish rack by the sink and was trying to show Staff 3 what he
found. Youth A reported he was in the kitchen and Staff 3 was
sitting at the table in the dining room. Youth A reported he said
“[Staff 3] look” and she responded “no”. Youth A reported he said
“[Staff 3] this is serious. Look, for real”, but Staff 3 still wouldn’t
look at him. Youth A reported Staff 3 came out of the office and
asked where he got the knife from. Youth A told Staff 3 it was in
2

the dish rack like someone had just used it and washed it. Youth A
reported the knife still had the guard on it while he was holding it.
Youth A reported Youth B came by the kitchen window, and he
showed Youth B the knife. Youth A reported Youth B took it as he
was threatening her, but that wasn’t his intention at all. Youth A
reported he didn’t find out until a day, or two later Youth B told the
police something other than what happened. Youth A reported the
police met with him at school to ask him about the situation, and
Youth A reported he apologized to Youth B later that day. Youth A
reported at the time of the incident, Youth B didn’t show any fear
or say anything to show Youth A did anything wrong, so he was
confused when the police talked to him about the situation. Youth
A reported the knives are supposed to be locked in a lock box in
the pantry, and the lock box was still located in the pantry at the
time he found the knife on the dish rack.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/16/24. Youth B reported she went towards the kitchen to get
breakfast but stopped in the dining room. Youth B reported Youth
A was in the kitchen with a knife in his hand. Youth B reported
Youth A had the knife in his hand and walked towards the kitchen
window separating the kitchen and dining room. Youth B reported
the knife had a cover on it, and Youth A was sliding the cover up
and down on the knife as he walked towards her. Youth B
reported Youth A didn’t verbally or physically threaten her. Youth
B reported Staff 1 put her hand out and stopped Youth A from
walking forwards anymore. Youth B reported Staff 1 said, “stop
[Youth A]” and asked him to give her the knife. Youth B reported
she didn’t know how Youth A got a knife, and she doesn’t know
where the knives are normally kept. Youth B reported she only
remembered Staff 1 being around and doesn’t remember Staff 2
or Staff 3 being involved. Youth B reported a couple days prior to
this, Youth A told her he would slit her throat and watch her die,
but there were no staff around to hear him say it.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/16/24.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was in the kitchen, and she heard he
kept calling Staff 3’s name, so she went to see what was going on.
Staff 1 reported when she got into the kitchen, she noticed Youth
A had a knife in his hand and was waving it in the air. Staff 1 told
Youth A, “We need to get that. You’re not supposed to have that”.
Youth B came over by the kitchen window when Youth A was
waving the knife around. Staff 1 reported it took her prompting
Youth A approximately 4 times before Youth A complied with the
request and returned the knife. Staff 1 reported she never once
felt threatened by him, felt that he threatened Youth B, and she
3

did not feel he was in any danger of harming anyone. Staff 1
reported when Youth B ran away from the area, it was because
she was called to get her medications, not because she was
fearful of the situation. Staff 1 reported while Youth A was holding
the knife, he didn’t make any jokes, threats, and did not wave the
knife at anyone specifically. Staff 1 reported Youth A never
threatened Youth B, and Staff 1 was between both youth the
entire time Youth A had the knife. Staff 1 reported she wasn’t sure
how he got the knife because she had recently arrived for her shift
and hadn’t touched any knives or been in the kitchen yet that
morning. Staff 1 reported the policy is staff are supposed to count
them and make sure they’re all present at the end of their shift.
Staff 1 reported when she went into the pantry where they keep
the knife lock box, the lock box was open. Staff 1 reported the
knife lock box is always supposed to be locked. Staff 1 reported
the door to the pantry was broken from the previous day due to
another youth’s behaviors. Staff 1 reported she wasn’t sure if he
obtained the knife from going into the pantry or if the knife was left
out by accident.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 12/17/24. Staff 2 reported
she called Youth A over to get his medications, and then told him
to go eat breakfast. Shortly after Youth A went to the kitchen, Staff
2 heard Youth A calling for Staff 3 and Staff 1 repeatedly. Staff 2
looked at the kitchen area and saw Youth A holding up a knife.
Staff 2 reported Youth A said, “you guys, a knife is out”. Staff 2
reported she let Staff 1 and Staff 3 handle the knife situation with
Youth A while she gave the other youth, including Youth B, their
medications. Staff 2 reported she didn’t see what happened in the
kitchen, but she didn’t have any reason to believe Youth A was
being threatening with the knife as there were no distressing
noises, escalated voices or movement, etc. Staff 2 admitted it was
her fault because she left the knife out after cutting her food up on
third shift. Staff 2 reported she washed it and put it in the drying
rack by the sink. Staff 2 reported she normally puts the knives
away right away, but she forgot to that night. Staff 2 reported the
knives are normally locked in a lockbox in the pantry, but she left
the lockbox unlocked and open in the pantry because she was
waiting to shut it until she put the knife away. Staff 2 reported the
knife normally has a cover and the cover was sitting by the knife
drying as well. Staff 2 reported had she heard something cluing
her in that there was a more serious issue happening, she would
have assisted. Staff 2 reported Youth B likes to instigate things
and make up stories. Staff 2 reported one time she was
transporting Youth A and Youth B, and the car ride was fine.
4

However, later, Youth B reported Youth A beat her up in the car,
which wasn’t true.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 12/17/24. Staff 3 reported
she was at the table watching down the bedroom hallway because
there were youth in their bedrooms. Staff 3 reported Youth A went
into the kitchen and kept calling Staff 3’s name. Staff 3 reported
she didn’t want to look at him because she was upset with him.
Staff 3 reported when she finally looked over, Youth B was in the
kitchen and had a knife in his hand. Staff 3 reported Staff 2 was
using the knife earlier and must have forgotten to put it away. Staff
3 reported Youth A clinked Staff 2’s pan with the knife. Staff 3
reported Youth B went to the kitchen to get breakfast. Staff 3
reported she couldn’t see what happened, but from what she
heard, Staff 1 was keeping Youth A away from Youth B because
she was saying “[Youth A] back up” or “stay away”. Staff 3 heard
Staff 1 redirecting Youth A but didn’t know what happened or why
he was being redirected.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video from 12/10/24 was reviewed. The only camera angle that
was reviewed was in the dining room area facing the window
looking into the kitchen. There is no camera located in the kitchen
so no other angles could be viewed. Youth B approaches the
window in between the kitchen and dining room. Staff 1 can be
seen in the kitchen by the window. Youth B leans on the kitchen
windowsill. Youth A makes a move towards the window, but it’s
not clear what he does or what object he’s holding. Staff 1 puts
her arm out to block Youth A. Youth B steps back from the
window. Youth B stands there for a few seconds, and then run
towards the location of the medication room.
TOUR OBSERVATION:
A tour of the facility occurred on 12/16/24. The pantry door where
the knife lock box is kept in was viewed to be in working order.
The knife box was in the pantry and was locked. There was a note
on the top of the knife box listing the contents of the box. Pictures
were taken.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Email sent to staff from CA on 12/12/24 regarding sharps
as well as Youth A and Youth B’s safety plans. Youth A and
Youth B are not to ride in the same vehicle together unless
necessary and approved by CA. Staff must sweep Youth
B’s room every day and notify CA and Supervisor
immediately if any sharps are found on his person or in his
5

room. Limit Youth B’s interactions with Youth A to only what
is necessary. When they are in the same room, a staff must
be present.
• Incident report dated 12/10/24 authored by Staff 1. The
incident report is consistent with Staff 1’s interview except
the incident report notes Youth A tried to grab another knife
out of the pantry after Staff 1 took the first knife.
• Resident Handbook pg. 2 states all kitchen utensils are to
be in their proper storage place, under staff supervision, to
prepare meals.
• Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Signature pages for the Group Home Manual
and Employee Handbook signed by Staff 2 on 10/11/23
acknowledge she received, read and would abide by them.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, Staff 2 left a knife out, which was accessible to youth.
Staff 2 admitted to leaving the knife out on the counter drying
instead of locking it up after use, and admitted she also left the
knife lock box unlocked despite the pantry door being broken,
which also left those knives accessible to youth.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility should make their policy clearer regarding
expectations for sharps (i.e. locked in lock box, lock box locked in
locked pantry, sharps checked and logged at the end of each shift,
etc.).
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2024SIC0001478 dated 7/17/24; CAP approved 8/2/24
SIR #2023C0000500 dated 9/2/23; CAP approved 8/14/23
SIR #2023C0000532 dated 7/6/23; CAP approved 8/16/23
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
January 22, 2025
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
Licensing Consultant

Area Manager

sir_summary.summary: A youth gained access to a steak knife left unsecured by staff in the Adrian Group Home kitchen, leading to a situation where another youth felt threatened, prompting staff intervention. The investigation substantiated a violation of staffing rules due to insufficient supervision and failure to secure dangerous items, as a staff member admitted leaving the knife out and the lockbox unlocked. This was a repeat violation, indicating systemic failures in safety protocols. The facility and the admitting staff member bear clear responsibility for creating the hazardous situation.
